text: CAREER OPPORTUNITY
label: HH1

text: U.S. DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION
label: HH1

text: FEDERAL RAILROAD ADMINISTRATION (FRA)
label: HH1

text: ANNOUNCEMENT NUMBER:
label: HH2

text: FRA-09-48V
label: BODY

text: POSITION TITLE:
label: HH2

text: Railroad Safety Inspector (Motive Power
label: BODY

text: and Equipment), GS-2121-11/12
label: BODY

text: Full Performance Level:  GS-12
label: BODY

text: Note: This position has special requirements. See
label: BODY

text: page 3.  Salary: GS-11 - $56,411 to $73,329 per
label: BODY

text: annum; GS-12 - $67,613 to $89,893 per annum
label: BODY

text: POSITION LOCATION:
label: HH2

text: Federal Railroad Administration
label: BODY

text: Office of Safety, Southern Region
label: BODY

text: Louisville, Kentucky
label: BODY

text: Who May Apply:       FRA Wide (FRA status candidates and FRA candidates
label: BODY

text: eligible for special appointing authorities.  Candidates eligible for
label: HH1

text: consideration under the Career Transition Assistance Program also may
label: HH1

text: apply.)
label: HH1

text: OPENING DATE:
label: HH2

text: CLOSING DATE:
label: HH2

text: NUMBER AND TYPE:
label: HH2

text: One Full-Time Permanent Position
label: BODY

text: Due to U.S. mail delays, it is recommended that applicants fax, use a professional delivery service
label: HH3

text: (i.e., FedEx, UPS, etc.), email, or personally deliver applications to ensure timely receipt.
label: HH3

text: DOT is an Equal Opportunity Employer
label: BODY

text: All qualified applicants will be considered regardless of political affiliation, race, color, religion, national
label: BODY

text: origin, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, or other non-merit factors.  DOT provides
label: BODY

text: reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities.  If you need a reasonable accommodation for
label: BODY

text: any part of the application and hiring process, please notify us. Decisions on granting reasonable
label: BODY

text: accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.
label: BODY

text: Why Work For Us?  Transportation impacts every facet of American life, providing people
label: HH2

text: access to work, school, loved ones, and nature’s rich bounty.  The U.S. Department of
label: BODY

text: Transportation is committed to transportation excellence and strives to create the best possible
label: BODY

text: integrated air, land, and sea transportation system for America.  As a DOT employee, you will
label: BODY

text: become a part of the dedicated workforce who work day-to-day to make measurable
label: BODY

text: improvements in our transportation system, the security of our nation, and the quality of
label: BODY

text: American life.
label: BODY

text: The Federal Railroad Administration, an Operating Administration under the Department of
label: BODY

text: Transportation, was created to promote and enforce safety throughout the U.S. railroad system,
label: BODY

text: rehabilitate the Northeast Corridor rail passenger services, consolidate Federal support for rail
label: BODY

text: transportation, and support research and development for rail transportation for passengers,
label: BODY

text: railroad employees and the general public.
label: BODY

text: Summary Of The Essential Job Functions:  As a Railroad Safety Inspector
label: HH2

text: (Motive Power and Equipment), you will be required to:
label: HH1

text: • Carry out periodic inspections to ensure uniform application of and compliance with
label: BODY

text: motive power and equipment regulations, rules and laws.
label: BODY

text: • Conduct investigations of accidents which result in serious injury to persons or property
label: BODY

text: of the railroads and develop comprehensive reports of findings and recommendations.
label: BODY

text: • Investigate complaints of unsafe conditions or noncompliance with motive power and
label: BODY

text: equipment, safety appliance and power brake laws.
label: BODY

text: • Promote cooperation between FRA, carriers, shippers, labor organizations and States to
label: BODY

text: improve railroad safety.
label: BODY

text: What Are The Minimum Qualifications For This Position?
label: HH2

text: You must have at least one year of specialized experience in or directly related to the
label: BODY

text: essential job functions described above. For Federal employees this experience must have
label: BODY

text: been at the next lower grade level.  If you want us to consider experience you obtained
label: BODY

text: outside the Federal Government, it must have been at that same level of complexity. The
label: BODY

text: specialized experience must demonstrate:
label: BODY

text: • Broad knowledge of the railroad industry including economic and operating
label: BODY

text: considerations and equipment;
label: BODY

text: • Knowledge of the general safety and health principles and practices applicable to the
label: BODY

text: railroad industry;
label: BODY

text: • Knowledge of railroad accident investigation techniques; and
label: BODY

text: • Skill in written and oral communication.
label: BODY

text: • Knowledge of the design, maintenance or inspections of various types of locomotives and
label: BODY

text: freight cars currently in use and their capabilities and limitations;
label: BODY

text: • Knowledge of the installation, maintenance or testing of railroad safety appliances and
label: BODY

text: power brakes, and their capabilities and limitations; and,
label: BODY

text: • Knowledge of applicable Federal laws and regulations pertaining to inspection and
label: BODY

text: testing of locomotives, freight cars, safety appliances and power brakes.
label: BODY

text: What Are The Desired Knowledge, Skills And Abilities For This Job?
label: HH1

text: See the Qualification Requirements listed above.
label: BODY

text: Other Special Job Requirements
label: HH1

text: • If selected, you will be required to possess a valid State driver’s license at all times while
label: BODY

text: employed by the FRA in order to perform the duties of the position.
label: BODY

text: • If selected, you must pass a Drug Test prior to appointment unless you are presently
label: BODY

text: employed in a DOT position that requires drug testing.  You also will be subject to
label: BODY

text: random drug testing while employed in this safety-sensitive position.
label: BODY

text: • The position requires extensive travel.
label: BODY

text: • If selected, you may choose to work out of FRA-provided office space, or subject to the
label: BODY

text: approval of the supervisor, another approved office space (e.g., place of residence)
label: BODY

text: How Will The Qualified Applicants Be Further Evaluated And Rated To
label: HH1

text: Identify The Best Qualified?  If you are basically qualified for this job, you will be further
label: BODY

text: evaluated on the quality and extent of your total accomplishments, experience and education
label: BODY

text: related to the knowledge, skills and abilities listed below, if any.  We also may consider your
label: BODY

text: performance appraisal, awards, and relevant training.  Your ranking will measure the degree to
label: BODY

text: which your background matches the demands of this position.
label: BODY

text: What Employee Benefits Do We Provide? The Federal Government offers excellent
label: BODY

text: benefits, flexible work schedules and family-friendly programs.  You will receive paid annual
label: BODY

text: leave and sick leave.  Depending on whether the position you are applying for is permanent or
label: BODY

text: time limited, you will be eligible for retirement, health insurance, life insurance and Long Term
label: BODY

text: Care insurance. A brief summary of the Federal benefits for permanent employees can be found
label: BODY

text: at www.usajobs.opm.gov/EI61.htm.
label: BODY

text: Before You Go Any Further, Here Are Some Other Things You Need to Know
label: HH2

text: • United States citizenship is required.  (Proof of citizenship will be required to be shown upon
label: BODY

text: appointment.)
label: BODY

text: • You must meet the qualification and time-in-grade requirements by the closing date of the
label: BODY

text: announcement.
label: BODY

text: • If you can be appointed under a special appointment authority, please let us know on your
label: BODY

text: application the special appointing authority for which you can be considered.  You must
label: BODY

text: submit proof of your eligibility for a special appointment authority.
label: BODY

text: • If the selection results in the promotion or reassignment of a current FRA Railroad Safety
label: BODY

text: Inspector Trainee, travel and transportation expenses to the new duty location will be paid by
label: BODY

text: the FRA in accordance with applicable Federal regulations.  If the selection results in the
label: BODY

text: reassignment of a current GS-12 FRA employee or a change to lower grade of a current FRA
label: BODY

text: employee, transportation and travel expenses will NOT be paid.
label: BODY

text: • The FRA has determined that seniority rights, leaves of absence, and reemployment rights
label: BODY

text: generally constitute an actual or an appearance of a conflict of interest.  New employees may
label: BODY

text: be required to divest themselves of such rights immediately upon hire if these rights are
label: BODY

text: determined to constitute an actual or appearance of a conflict of interest.  If new employees
label: BODY

text: are permitted to retain such rights, which is generally the case for Railroad Safety Inspectors,
label: BODY

text: the rights must be divested at the end of the one year probationary period.  No waivers of this
label: BODY

text: requirement will be granted.
label: BODY

text: • FRA employees are prohibited from owning railroad stock, except, under certain
label: BODY

text: circumstances, as part of a diversified mutual fund.
label: BODY

text: • If selected, you will be subject to the Standards of Ethical Conduct applicable to all DOT
label: BODY

text: employees.
label: BODY

text: How To Apply For This Position
label: HH1

text: 1) You may submit your current Resume or an OF-612 (Optional Application for Federal
label: HH3

text: Employment).  The OF-612 can be found on the OPM website at www.opm.gov under
label: BODY

text: Federal Forms. You may choose which form to submit provided it contains all required
label: BODY

text: information.  Required information is listed in the section below labeled “Here’s What Your
label: BODY

text: Application Must Contain.”  Please be sure to indicate what grade level(s) you are applying
label: BODY

text: for and the duty location.
label: BODY

text: 2) You may submit the attached Voluntary Reassignment Application Form instead of an
label: HH3

text: application or resume if you are eligible for consideration for voluntary reassignment to
label: BODY

text: Railroad Safety Inspector, GS-12 positions under Article 11, Section D of the Memorandum
label: BODY

text: of Agreement between the FRA and the American Federation of Government Employees,
label: BODY

text: Local 2814 dated May 2000.  If you are not eligible under the above Article 11, Section D,
label: BODY

text: you must submit one of the forms listed in (1) above.
label: BODY

text: 3) A complete performance appraisal is required.  It must be current – meaning it was issued to
label: BODY

text: you within the past year – and it must be official – meaning it appraises your performance
label: BODY

text: over a normal rating cycle in your present job and has been signed by your supervisor.  If you
label: BODY

text: are unable to submit your current performance appraisal, please tell us why. You also should
label: BODY

text: submit a copy of your latest SF-50 "Notification of Personnel Action” that reflects career or
label: BODY

text: career-conditional tenure.  You do not need to submit a performance appraisal or an SF-50 if
label: BODY

text: you are using the Voluntary Reassignment Application Form.
label: BODY

text: 4) To be considered for selection priority under the Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP),
label: BODY

text: you must submit appropriate certification that you are eligible.  In addition, you must be
label: BODY

text: determined to be well-qualified for the position.  Well-qualified applicant:  An eligible
label: BODY

text: applicant who meets all qualifications, standards, and eligibility requirements for the position,
label: BODY

text: including medical qualifications; minimum educational and experience requirements; selective
label: BODY

text: placement factors; knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs); quality ranking factors; and any
label: BODY

text: other special qualifying conditions, and is able to satisfactorily perform the duties of the
label: BODY

text: position upon entry.
label: BODY

text: Where To Send Your Application
label: HH1

text: You may mail or deliver your application to the Federal Railroad Administration, Office of Human
label: BODY

text: Resources, 1200 New Jersey Avenue, SE West Building W34-201, Washington, DC 20590.
label: BODY

text: If you are faxing your application, please limit the application to a maximum of 20 pages and
label: BODY

text: include a cover sheet.  Our fax number is 202/493-6169.  We will not accept applications faxed from
label: BODY

text: a Federal Government fax machine.  You may email your application package to
label: BODY

text: Katherine.Lavado@dot.gov.
label: BODY

text: ALL applications must be in our office or postmarked by the closing date of the announcement.
label: BODY

text: Applications mailed in a Government envelope will not be accepted.
label: BODY

text: Questions?
label: HH1

text: Call the Human Resources Office at 202/493-6112 or TDD 202/493-6487 or 6488, or email at
label: BODY

text: Katherine.Lavado@dot.gov. Please reference the announcement number so we can help you more
label: HH3

text: efficiently.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: en las Federal Railroad Administration (FRA), por favor llame a Francisco Gonzalez 202/493-6076.  La
label: BODY

text: FRA es un empleador con igualidad de oportunidad en el empleo, y que por medio de programas de
label: BODY

text: accion afirmativa mantiene un ambiente multicultural.  Todos los que soliciten recibiran igual
label: BODY

text: consideracion, sin ninguna excepcion, por raza, color, religion, sexo, origin nacional, politica,
label: BODY

text: inpedimento fisico o edad.
label: BODY

label: HH3

label: BODY
